intro: Acorellus laevigatus, commonly known as the smooth acorellus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its stout, unbranched stem and clustered leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Its leaves are elongated, narrow, and have a smooth texture, contributing to its common name. Acorellus laevigatus is often found in wetland habitats and is adapted to moist, sandy soils.
